content:
The effects of meditation can vary from person to person, so there is no definite timeline for when the effects will show. However, some studies have shown that regular meditation practice can produce positive effects on mental health in as little as 8 weeks of consistent practice. 

The benefits of meditation may not be immediate, but with regular practice, one may experience reduced symptoms of anxiety and depression over time. It's important to note that meditation is not a quick fix, and it is recommended to practice regularly over a longer period of time for the best results. 

It’s also worth mentioning that the duration and frequency of meditation practice can influence how quickly one may see the benefits. Some individuals may experience benefits after only 10-15 minutes of daily practice, while others may require more prolonged sessions, several times a week. 

Ultimately, the key is to be consistent and patient with the practice as the effects of meditation can be cumulative and long-lasting.
